intro: Conophyllum latibracteatum, commonly known as the broad-bract conophyllum, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy bracts that often resemble petals. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with bright colors that attract various pollinators. Conophyllum latibracteatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
